instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi, 

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no image on the external monitor, but everything else is working well. On the board everithing seems ok, and I have no idea from where to start the diagnose. Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Any history available?
Clean Thunderbolt connector as first step.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi. 
No history. The client says that it just stop working, and there is no signs of oxidation on the board.
Already cleaned the connector without success.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>DP_PWR</SIGNAL> at J3200.
Also check for reaction at <SIGNAL>HOT_PLUG_DETECT</SIGNAL>, when connect/disconnect a Thunderbolt device.

Try another Thunderbolt adapter too, just in case.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_PWR</SIGNAL> (on <RESISTOR>R3201</RESISTOR>) has 3.3v
<SIGNAL>HOT_PLUG_DETECT</SIGNAL>  (on <CAPACITOR>C3202</CAPACITOR>) has a voltage drop when conected an dvi adapter (from 0.156 to 0.08)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
That is irrelevant, the signal must go high.
Try changing <CHIP>U3220</CHIP>; be sure to have good solders and traces.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Some changes.
After replacing <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, i get an image on external monitor, but with very, very bad quality (green image with several large horizontal stripes). Can it be a bad <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, or bad solders?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: <CHIP>U3220</CHIP> manages the data lines for Thunderbolt port.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
It worked. It were bad solders on the new <CHIP>U3220</CHIP>.
Thank you so much.
Regards,
